headline: How Investors May Respond To Bank of New York Mellon (BK) AI Expansion, Rate Cut and Board Refresh
summary: In recent days, BNY Mellon cut its Prime Lending Rate by 0.25 percentage points to 6.75%, deepened its Gemini Enterprise AI integration with Google Cloud across its Eliza platform, and announced the upcoming 2026 addition of former Prudential CEO Charles F. Lowrey as an independent director. Together, these moves highlight BNY Mellon's push to blend advanced AI across its operations while reinforcing board independence and client-focused lending terms. We’ll now explore how BNY Mellon’s...
